perturbation.original_text:
1.9 “Net Sales” means, with respect to the Product, the gross invoiced sales price payable to ArTara and/or its Affiliates and their respective
licensees and sublicensees for sales anywhere in the world of the Product to a third party, less:
(a) discounts (including cash, quantity and patient program discounts), retroactive price reductions, charge-back payments and
rebates granted to managed health care organizations or to federal, state and local governments, their agencies, and
purchasers and reimbursers or to trade customers;
(b) credits or allowances actually, not to exceed the original invoice amount, granted upon claims, damaged goods, rejections or
returns of the Product, including the Product returned in connection with recalls or withdrawals;
(c) freight out, postage, shipping and insurance charges for delivery of the Product if charged separately and include in the gross
receipts; and
(d) taxes or duties, excluding income taxes and value-added taxes, levied on, absorbed or otherwise imposed on the sale of the
Product, including governmental charges otherwise imposed upon the billed amount, as adjusted for rebates and refunds,
provided that such are included in gross receipts and are paid to and/or its Affiliates and their respective licensees and
sublicensees.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.9 “Net Sales” means, with respect to the Product, the gross invoiced sales price payable to ArTara and/or its Affiliates and their respective
licensees and sublicensees for sales anywhere in the world of the Product to a third party, less:
(a) discounts (including only cash discounts), retroactive price reductions, charge-back payments and
rebates granted to only managed health care organizations or to federal agencies, and
purchasers;
(b) credits or allowances actually, not to exceed the original invoice amount, granted upon only claims, damaged goods, or rejections of
the Product, including the Product returned in connection with recalls;
(c) freight out charges for delivery of the Product if charged separately and include in the gross
receipts; and
(d) taxes or duties, excluding income taxes, levied on, absorbed or otherwise imposed on the sale of the
Product, including governmental charges otherwise imposed upon the billed amount, as adjusted for rebates and refunds,
provided that such are included in gross receipts and are paid to and/or its Affiliates and their respective licensees and
sublicensees.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "Net Sales" includes a broad range of deductions from the gross sales price. The modified version significantly restricts these deductions (e.g., limiting discounts, rebates, and credits), thereby inflating the 'Net Sales' figure and potentially increasing royalty payments. This creates ambiguity because the specific exclusions now contradict standard accounting practices which dictate a wider range of permissible deductions to accurately reflect actual revenue. This introduces uncertainty in royalty calculation and enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 Confidentiality. During the term of this Agreement and for a period of seven (7) years after its termination or expiration each Party (the
“Receiving Party”) shall maintain in confidence and, except as authorized by this Agreement, not use any know-how, data, processes, techniques,
formulas, test data and other information disclosed by the other Party (the “Disclosing Party”) and which for any of the foregoing, if written, is
marked “Confidential” by the Disclosing Party or, if verbal or visual, is identified in writing as “Confidential” at the time of disclosure and reduced
to writing by the Disclosing Party within thirty (30) days of the verbal or visual disclosure (“Confidential Information”).
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 Confidentiality. During the term of this Agreement each Party (the
“Receiving Party”) shall maintain in general confidence and, except as generally authorized by this Agreement, generally not use any know-how, data,
processes, techniques,
formulas, test data and other information disclosed by the other Party (the “Disclosing Party”) and which for any of the foregoing, if written, is
marked “Private” by the Disclosing Party or, if verbal or visual, is identified verbally as “Private” at the time of disclosure (“Private Information”).
perturbation.explanation: The original clause protects 'Confidential Information' with a defined marking procedure and a 7-year term. The modified clause weakens this protection by using vague terms like "general confidence" and "generally not use", replacing 'Confidential' with 'Private' (which has no legal standing in this context), and removing the requirement for written confirmation of verbally disclosed information. This contradicts standard contract law which requires clear and enforceable terms for confidentiality, potentially rendering the clause unenforceable.

perturbation.original_text:
6.3 Indemnification by ArTara. To the extent permitted by law, ArTara agrees to defend, indemnify and hold the University of Iowa Research
Foundation, the University, the State of Iowa, the University’s Board of Regents, their respective affiliates, trustees, officers, directors, faculty,
staff, students, successors, assigns, independent contractors, agents and employees including but not limited to Principal Investigator
(“University Indemnitees”), harmless from and against any and all liability, loss, expense, reasonable adjudicated attorneys’ fees, or claims for injury
or damages arising out of the use of the Program Data by ArTara and its Affiliates and subcontractors including but not limited to the CRO
involved in the Project, but only in proportion to and to the extent such liability, loss, expense, attorneys’ fees, or claims for injury or damages are
caused by or result from the negligent or acts or omissions of ArTara, its officers, agents, employees, subcontractors, the CRO or Affiliates.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.3 Indemnification by ArTara. ArTara agrees to possibly defend, indemnify and possibly hold the University of Iowa Research
Foundation, the University, the State of Iowa, the University’s Board of Regents, their respective affiliates, trustees, officers, directors, faculty,
staff, students, successors, assigns, independent contractors, agents and employees including but not limited to Principal Investigator
(“University Indemnitees”), harmless from and against any and all liability, loss, expense, attorneys’ fees, or claims for injury
or damages arising out of the use of the Program Data by ArTara and its Affiliates and subcontractors including but not limited to the CRO
involved in the Project, if such liability, loss, expense, attorneys’ fees, or claims for injury or damages are
caused by or result from the any acts or omissions of ArTara, its officers, agents, employees, subcontractors, the CRO or Affiliates.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly states that ArTara will indemnify the University Indemnitees, with the extent of indemnification being proportional to ArTara's negligence. By adding the word "possibly", the obligation to defend and indemnify becomes uncertain. Further, removing "negligent" from "negligent acts or omissions" broadens the potential triggers for indemnification in an unclear way, creating a contradiction in the scope of coverage. This undermines the intended risk allocation and could render the indemnification clause unenforceable due to vagueness.
